bug.author: asahnovskiy
bug.summary: Dashboard deployed on eks does not show manage contributors in navigation
bug.description:
/kind bug
I deployed kubeflow v1.0.2 on existed EKS cluster using <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v1.0-branch/kfdef/kfctl_k8s_istio.v1.0.2.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v1.0-branch/kfdef/kfctl_k8s_istio.v1.0.2.yaml</denchmark-link>
What did you expect to happen: I except the "Manage Contributers" to show up. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: I assume v1.0.2 but I see build version dev_local at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard kfctl version: kfctl_v1.0.2-0-ga476281 Kubernetes platform: EKS 1.15.10 Kubernetes version:1.15.13 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):

comments.comment:

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/asahnovskiy>@asahnovskiy</denchmark-link>
kfctl_k8s_istio.v1.0.2.yaml manifest doesn't support multi-user, that's the reason you don't see it. Feel free to use following manifest based on your needs.
kfctl_aws_cognito.v1.0.2.yaml kfctl_istio_dex.v1.0.2.yaml
